channel.title: Seung Hyun (Sam) Min
channel.description: Recent content on Seung Hyun (Sam) Min

item.title: About
item.description: A PhD student at McGill University, I have been working with Prof. Robert Hess to study perception science, namely neural plasticity and binocular vision. As undergraduate, I worked with Prof. Ipek Oruc (UBC) on face perception and Prof. Gabriella Gobbi (McGill) on circadian physiology. Education PhD, Computational Neuroscience, Department of Ophthalmology and Visual Sciences, Quebec, McGill University (2017 - Present). Bachelors of Science, Anatomy and Cell Biology, McGill University, Quebec, Canada (2013-2017).

item.title: Clarinet clips
item.description: Here are some of my favorite clarinet clips. I have watched them countless times. Tchaikovsky’s Nutcracker for the clarinet and orchestra His playing is so lyrical. He sings with the clarinet. I can listen to his playing all day. Rossini’s variation His articulation is god-level. His conducting is also god-level. Everything about this so god. His cadenza in the end is legendary! Spohr #2 He effortlessly plays this notoriously difficult piece.

item.title: Publications
item.description: 2020 Xiaoxin Chen, Shijia Chen, Deying Kong, Junhan Wei, Yu Mao, Wenman Lin, Yiya Chen, Zhimo Yao, Seung Hyun Min, Fan Lu, Jia Qu, Robert F. Hess, Jiawei Zhou (2020). Action video gaming does not influence short-term ocular dominance plasticity in visually normal adults. eNeuro. Yiya Chen*, **Seung Hyun Min* **, Ziyun Cheng, Shijia Chen, Zili Wang, Chunwen Tao, Fan Lu, Jia Qu, Pi-Chun Huang, Robert Hess, Jiawei Zhou (2020).

item.title: Breathe by Lee hi
item.description: Breathe is one of my favorite songs. Many covers have been recorded. Here are my favorites. Original by Lee hi This is the original recording of the song. Han Dong Geun Han’s control of dynamic is amazing. His arrangement strays from the original but is absolutely beautiful. Kyu Hyun His voice is beautiful. Very clear and resonant. This rendition is very faithful to the original
